messages.body:
Attention
My name is Mr.Mairk John Lopez,the delivery officer of your package,I am 57yrs old. I was instructed by (Ray Fletcher) to deliver this package to you, Right now am at Republic International Airport, It is a pleasure to inform you that i have confirm your delivery and approved the delivery of your consignment to your home mailing address,However your Golden Metal Box  valued $5,316,000 USD, will be delivery to your address on Monday, your golden metal box with reg #: MU3990AV will be delivered to you  on Monday been 28th of April 2014 at 4:30:pm GMT .


At the check-in counter of Delta airlines the airline has demanded for (US YELLOW TAG) covering your  package Non-inspection of your Golden Metal Box,if you have it kindly forward it immediately or if you don't have it then it will cost you only $110 Dollars to obtain the (US YELLOW TAG) at US Embassy in Abuja Nigeria. Note that custom will not allow your Box to leave without showing them the (US YELLOW TAG), please act urgently to forward the (US YELLOW TAG) to enable me deliver your package on time on Monday


Your Box is now ready and confirms to leave  the only thing that will delay this delivery is the (US YELLOW TAG). therefore, if you don't have it kindly move to any western union or money gram ONLY to send the sum of $110 Dollars to their agent MAC WELLS.for an  urgent obtain of the (US YELLOW TAG) in Abuja Nigeria.


Please make sure you send the  $110usd via western union/money gram only below to.


Receiver's Name: MAC WELLS
Address: Abuja Nigeria
Amount: $110
Email; mairkjohn@aol.com


                                       PLEASE DON'T REPLY ME IF YOU DO NOT SEND THE MONEY FOR (US YELLOW TAG) covering your  package Non-inspection of your Golden Metal Box because i will not have your time.


Furnish me with the MTCN, sender's name and address once you are don, Please don't hesitate to call me if you have any question  regarding   (631) 759 7044


It is our wish to serve you better!!
Best Regards,
Mairk John Lopez

Scam-o-pause: the new reader may require an explanation. This scam (yes, it is a scam) works like so:
The victim is exhorted to send some amount, in this case $110, to pay the 'processing' fee on an imaginary Golden Metal Box (or whatever). There is no Golden Metal Box. The Box doesn't exist. It's not pining for the fjords. It's not even dead. It's Imaginary.
And now back to the scam:

messages.body:
I have sent the money you requested in a canvas bag.  It is full of pennies.  I had collected them over the years in a water bottle in my kitchen.  I hope you don't mind if some of them are a bit green.  It's just the way the copper oxidizes.


Thank you,


Vladimir Nabokov.
